components.description: A circular symbol, commonly used as a representation of peace. Alternatives include the Victory Hand, or the Dove of Peace.
components.title: Peace Symbol

description: A circular symbol, commonly used as a representation of peace. Alternatives include the Victory Hand, or the Dove of Peace.
title: Peace Symbol

version.description:
Unicode 1.1 were pre-dated emoji inclusion in Unicode by 17 years, and included many characters primarily sourced from the Zapf Dingbats font.

The following characters were added to Unicode in 1993 and many were given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols -> Religious and political symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A circular symbol, commonly used as a¬†representation of peace. Alternatives include the Victory Hand, or the Dove of Peace. Peace Symbol was http://emojipedia.org/peace-symbol/
emoji_net_data.name: peace symbol

bn:13633136v: To make peace; to put at peace; to be at peace.

bn:02208602n: A number of peace symbols have been used many ways in various cultures and contexts.

bn:00061149n: Peace is an occurrence of harmony characterized by the lack of violence, conflict behaviors and the freedom from fear of violence.
A state of tranquility, quiet, and harmony, e.g., a state free from civil disturbance.
Sometimes written on a rainbow flag
State of being comfortable or free from stress.
The state prevailing during the absence of war
A state of tranquility, quiet, and harmony. For instance, a state free from civil disturbance.
State of harmony characterized by lack of violent conflict and freedom from fear of violence
The state of being comfortable or free from stress.
Peace is an occurrence of harmony characterized by lack of violence, conflict behaviors and the freedom from fear of violence.
